content: bramblegloop materials hooks - 5mm unless otherwise specified 3 5mm 3mm & 2mm worsted weight yarn - main colors for head/body & front ears are green & brown i used a fuzzy yarn from amazon called squirrel yarn olive green - for back of ears vine nose & mouth smaller amounts of lime green eyebrow leaves brown tan pink dark & light yellow mushrooms acorn & sprouts larger safety eyes 24-30mm scissors stitch markers yarn needle & stuffing worked in the round unless otherwise noted - i put my stitch marker into the last stitch of the round mushroom #1 2 - 3 5mm hook light brown & light yellow - no need to stuff cap - light brown 1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring 2 single_crochet 6 3 increase around 12 4 4 increase single_crochet around 18 slip_stitch into next fo weave in end underside - light brown 1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring 2 increase around 12 3 increase single_crochet around 18 slip_stitch into next fo leave tail for sewing stem - light yellow 1 chain 2 single_crochet 4 into 2nd chain from hook 2-10 single_crochet around 9r of 4 fo leave tail for sewing sew stem to center of underside piece then sew underside piece to cap weave in ends mushroom #2 - 2 - 3 5mm hook two colors - dark yellow & light yellow or tan - don t stuff start with yellow - 1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring 2 increase around 12 3 increase single_crochet around 18 4 increase single_crochet 2 around 24 5 increase single_crochet 3 around 30 6 single_crochet around 30 7 slip_stitch-flo around 30 fo weave in end slip_stitch light yellow or tan into any back loop of round 7 ch1 1 blo - decrease single_crochet 3 around 24 2 decrease single_crochet 2 around 18 3 decrease single_crochet around 12 4 decrease around 6 5-7 single_crochet around 3r of 6 you can just count to 18 instead of counting row 8 increase single_crochet around 9 9-10 single_crochet around 2r of 9 11 decrease 5 times to close bottom slip_stitch into opposite side fo weave in end push the cap in a bit to give it a more chanterelle appearance head/body - start with green - 1 single_crochet 8 into magic_ring 2 increase around 16 3 increase single_crochet around 24 4 single_crochet around 24 5 increase single_crochet 2 around 32 6 single_crochet around 32 7 increase single_crochet 3 around 40 8-10 single_crochet around 3r of 40 11 increase single_crochet 4 around 48 12-14 single_crochet around 3r of 48 keep a stitch marker in the last stitch of round 14 the next four row will not count as the regular counted rounds these row will be the back of the head 1-4 single_crochet 24 ch1 turn - switch to brown on last stitch of row 4 do not ch1 tie the loose ends together to secure 15 slip_stitch into the last stitch of r14 marked stitch turn ch1 single_crochet into same stitch replace stitch marker
